title: Python Fundamentals
description: Core Python concepts used in data engineering workflows

lessons.title: Printing Output
lessons.instruction:
Use the print() function to display the text:

Hello, Data Engineer
lessons.hint: Strings must be wrapped in quotes.

lessons.title: Simple Math
lessons.hint: You can print a math expression directly.

lessons.title: Variables
lessons.instruction: Create a variable x with the value 10 and print it.
lessons.hint: Assign the variable first, then print it.

lessons.title: Lists
lessons.instruction: Create a list containing the numbers 1, 2, and 3, then print it.

lessons.title: String Concatenation
lessons.instruction:
Create two variables:

first = "Data"
second = "Engineer"

Print them together as:

Data Engineer
lessons.hint: You can combine strings using the + operator.

lessons.title: Numbers and Types
lessons.instruction:
Create a variable x with the value 5.

Print the type of x.

lessons.title: List Indexing
lessons.instruction:
Create a list named values with these numbers:

10, 20, 30

Print the first value in the list.

lessons.title: List Length
lessons.instruction:
Create a list with the values:

1, 2, 3, 4

Print how many items are in the list.

lessons.title: If Statements
lessons.instruction:
Create a variable x with the value 10.

If x is greater than 5, print:

Greater than 5
lessons.hint: Use an if statement with the > operator.

lessons.title: Else Statements
lessons.instruction:
Create a variable x with the value 3.

If x is greater than 5, print "High".
Otherwise, print "Low".

lessons.title: For Loops
lessons.instruction:
Use a for loop to print the numbers:

1
2
3
lessons.hint: You can loop over a list or use range().

lessons.title: Summing Values
lessons.instruction:
Create a list with the values:

1, 2, 3

Use a loop to calculate the total and print it.
lessons.hint: Start with total = 0 and add each value.
